title: Sure, here is a list of 20 articles up to 2023 that discuss conditioning large language models (LLMs) using task instructions, including various methods for creating such instructions
**"Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"** by Tom B. Brown et al
Introduces GPT-3 and discusses few-shot learning with task instructions
**"T5: Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer"** by Colin Raffel et al
Explores the Text-to-Text Transfer Transformer (T5) and its use of task instructions
**"Instruction-Based Fine-Tuning for Zero-Shot Task Generalization"** by Yizhong Wang et al
Discusses fine-tuning LLMs with task instructions for zero-shot generalization
**"Prompt Programming for Large Language Models: Beyond the Few-Shot Paradigm"** by Ethan Perez et al
Explores different methods of prompt programming for LLMs
**"Unsupervised Data Augmentation for Consistency Training"** by Qizhe Xie et al
Discusses data augmentation methods that can be used to create task instructions
**"Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer"** by Colin Raffel et al
Examines the T5 model and its ability to handle various tasks through instruction-based learning
**"Multitask Prompted Training Enables Zero-Shot Task Generalization"** by Jason Wei et al
Investigates the effectiveness of multitask prompted training for task generalization
**"Prompting GPT-3 To Be Reliable"** by Ethan Perez et al
Discusses methods to improve the reliability of GPT-3 through better task instructions
**"Learning to Summarize with Human Feedback"** by Nisan Stiennon et al
Explores how human feedback can be used to condition LLMs for summarization tasks
**"The Power of Scale for Parameter-Efficient Prompt Tuning"** by Brian Lester et al
Investigates parameter-efficient methods for prompt tuning in large language models
**"Prompt-Based Learning for Natural Language Processing: A Survey"** by Pengfei Liu et al
A comprehensive survey on prompt-based learning methods for NLP tasks
**"Calibrate Before Use: Improving Few-Shot Performance of Language Models"** by Tony Z
Discusses calibration techniques to enhance few-shot learning performance
**"Prefix-Tuning: Optimizing Continuous Prompts for Generation"** by Xiang Lisa Li and Percy Liang
Introduces prefix-tuning as a method for optimizing task instructions
**"Adapting Language Models for Zero-Shot Learning by Meta-Learning"** by Douwe Kiela et al
Explores meta-learning techniques for adapting LLMs to new tasks with minimal instructions
**"Self-Diagnosis and Self-Debiasing: A Proposal for Reducing Corpus-Based Bias in NLP"** by Emily Dinan et al
Proposes methods for self-diagnosis and self-debiasing in LLMs using task instructions
**"P-Tuning: Prompt Tuning Can Be Comparable to Fine-Tuning Across Scales and Tasks"** by Xiang Lisa Li and Percy Liang
Examines the effectiveness of prompt tuning compared to traditional fine-tuning
**"Improving Language Models by Retrieving from Trillions of Tokens"** by Sebastian Borgeaud et al
Discusses retrieval-augmented generation and its impact on task instruction effectiveness
**"Learning to Prompt for Vision-Language Models"** by Zhi Tian et al
Explores prompt learning techniques for vision-language models
**"Prompting for a Conversation: How to Control a Dialog Model?"** by Chia-Wei Liu et al
Investigates methods for controlling dialogue models through task-specific prompts
**"Task-Agnostic Meta-Learning for Few-Shot Learning"** by Chelsea Finn et al
Although slightly older, this foundational work on meta-learning is relevant for understanding task instruction creation
These articles cover a range of topics related to conditioning LLMs using task instructions, from foundational concepts to advanced techniques and applications
